About the job
Wakam assure la conception de produits d'assurances sur-mesure qui sont ensuite distribués par des partenaires distributeurs (courtiers, insurtech, retailer) sur un modèle B2B2C en marque blanche.

Pour répondre à ces enjeux, Wakam a construit une plateforme technologique composée d'une partie "customer facing" (différents portails) et d'une Data Platform servant à l'intégration des données des partenaires distributeurs (contrats d'assurance, quittances, sinistres), à leur stockage et supportant les différents cas d'usages de transformation et valorisation (Business Intelligence, Data Science, alimentation de systèmes opérationnels).

⌖ La Mission

Pour accompagner la forte croissance de l'entreprise, Wakam est à la recherche d'un(e) Data Engineer BI/DataViz qui a à cœur l'excellence technique, avec une approche de la data par des pratiques issues du Software Development, et apprécie travailler dans un contexte Agile avec une approche Produit.

Au sein de l'équipe Projets/BI du Data Office, la/le Data Engineer BI/DataViz participe au cadrage et au développement des évolutions fonctionnelles et techniques des usages BI et Data.

Nous travaillons dans un écosystème technique Azure, Power BI, Databricks et Snowflake.

Description du poste :
Concevoir, spécifier, développer et documenter des traitements BI d'ETL/ELT, data préparation, modélisation décisionnelle, calculs de KPIs et reporting comprenant les technologies suivantes (liste non exhaustive) : Power BI, SQL (Snowflake, Databricks), Azure LogicApps, Python dans une approche DevOps (build et run)
Accompagner les utilisateurs autour des sujets de DataViz et Self Service BI : Participer à des ateliers pour aider à définir les objectifs, KPIs et les visuels pour répondre à leur(s) usage(s), les former et les accompagner.
Administration de Power BI
Travailler en méthodologie Agile, en collaboration avec les Products Owner et les Business Analysts, détailler les US en tâches, estimer la complexité et les efforts d'implémentations, et accompagner la recette.
Garantir la qualité et les performances de ces développements en mettant en place des stratégies de tests automatiques et de déploiement continu. Veiller à la mise en place et au respect des « best practices ».
Être force de proposition : proposer des solutions pour améliorer de façon continue les usages BI
Participer à la réalisation de Proof of Concept dans le cadre d'activités de R&D.
Veille technologique et partage de connaissance auprès des pairs

✯ Profil recherché
Vous avez au minimum 4/5 d'expérience sur un poste similaire, vous êtes très à l'aise sur les modélisations décisionnelles, le SQL et vous avez déjà mené avec succès des projets BI intégrant l'outil Power BI.
Outre vos compétences de développement, vous avez une expérience qualifiée dans la compréhension des besoins fonctionnels des utilisateurs. Vous aimez comprendre le travail des métiers et leurs usages BI. Vous êtes autonome dans le recueil de leurs besoins, leur formation et leur accompagnement via l'animation d'ateliers dédiés.
Vous maîtrisez les pratiques et les concepts associés au Software Development (Git, Clean Code, Tests auto, REST API, etc.)
Vous avez des connaissances en DevOps (CI/CD, Docker, Infra as Code).
Vous êtes force de proposition, créatif et innovant, portez un grand soin à la qualité et à la performance de vos développements.
Vous maîtrisez l'anglais dans un contexte professionnel (lu, écrit, parlé)

Qualités attendues :
Vous êtes passionné(e) par votre métier et souhaitez partager votre expérience
Vous êtes animé par une démarche d'apprentissage et d'amélioration continue
Vous êtes apprécié(e) pour votre engagement

Process de recrutement
Echange avec Danny, Lead Recruiter
Echange technique avec Cédric, BI Project Manager
Echange avec avec Sergio, Head of Data Science
Echange RH avec Amandine - Chief People Officer et/ou Laura - Head of Talent

=> Welcome @Wakam 🙌

Positive energy, agility, and team spirit are essential to support Wakam in its hyper-growth!

You have the Wakam mindset? Join us!

More about us

Our culture? Free to impact. A culture where everything is possible, where all ideas are taken into consideration, where everyone has an impact on the transformation of insurance! Hungry for freedom? Thirsty for autonomy? If you are adventurous and like challenges, then the Wakam adventure might be made for you!

Discover -on our website- who we really are with the 11 cultural markers that so well describe us!

What we are looking for

Mindset compatibility with our 'Free to Impact' culture:
Think big
Biased for action
Curious and eager to learn
Can say no and find solutions
Aims for the moon (but please don't stick on the moon)
And above all: have fun working together 🤜🤛 !

Good to know
Wakam is not based on a hierarchy but on a methodology where everyone finds his role and knows his objectives.
With a flat hierarchical system and a highly collaborative operating model, Wakam is an extremely agile and transparent company.
Every last Friday of the month, it's Free.day at Wakam, a day without meetings to take a step aside and dedicate ourselves to skills sponsorship or other activities (because we are curious, I remind you).
Full-remote is a reality at Wakam (there is even one Wakamee who works from his sailing boat ⛵)

About the job
Our mission is to connect and optimize the world’s commerce. That means the whole world. So we’re determined to nurture our culture of meritocracy where everyone can thrive, no matter what we look like, where we’re from, how we grew up, whom we love, the nature of our faith, or how our bodies or minds work. We’re committed to achieving equity in treatment and opportunity for everyone, where people are judged on the merits and quality of their work.

It all starts with people. Inside every company, behind every brand - while business success is often measured in profit, it has always been powered by people. We firmly believe people are the heart of any organization - including our own. That’s why a career here provides much more than simple pay and perks. We’re dedicated to empowering people, solving tough problems, and helping careers flourish inside and out.

Position Summary

The Cloud Engineering team in the Platform Engineering organization operates to build a highly available, secure, and scalable cloud infrastructure. As a member of this team, an Infrastructure Engineer will be responsible for ensuring that our cloud infrastructure platform is continuously improved, secure, and scaled to meet the needs of our customers.

Your responsibilities will include creating, monitoring, and automating cloud infrastructure and pipelines, collaborating with engineering teams, security and other platform teams to deliver highly reliable and secure offerings, and providing support for existing solutions and consulting on how to automate their workloads on cloud infrastructure.

Responsibilities
Build infrastructure-as-code software and other tools providing a foundation for software teams to rapidly build large scale cloud systems
Establish a golden AMI pipeline and maintain a continuous patching schedule for all cloud resources.
Operationalize the resiliency and disaster recovery processes for IaaS landscape
Automation of key operating and security processes in IaaS workloads
Infrastructure management via Configuration Management platform to ensure security and full stack automation for applications, drive the use of the platform and standards for all applications
Drive investigation and resolution of security incidents impacting cloud infrastructure
Work closely with security team to address vulnerabilities, evidence gathering and securing our infrastructure
Handle the security hardening efforts for major OS distributions to ensure overall compliance and a streamlined service for internal customers
Participate in the rotating on-call schedule. Ensure that user emergencies, platform alerts, and support requests are addressed.
Ability to recognize and solve problems in cloud and hybrid environments and the ability to create and implement a new solution from scratch.
From code, to compile, to test, to deployment, you are enthusiastic about the software lifecycle beyond just writing code.
You enjoy working in a highly collaborative/Agile environment with other team members as well as all of software engineering.
You have the ability to operate independently and self-prioritize work. You are a good team player, and exceptional communicator.
You enjoy learning new technologies and help foster a collegial environment of continuous improvement and innovation.
Requirements
5+ years' experience building AWS infrastructure and migrating private on-premises solutions to cloud environments. Worked in AWS environments with high availability
Knowledge and experience of high availability and scalability
Experience with AWS foundations, including compute, networking, storage, and security
Experience architecting containerization solutions in cloud environments like ECS or EKS . A strong background in systems engineering, especially with tools like Docker and Kubernetes in Linux and containerized environments
Expertise in implementing content delivery solutions at the edge
A thorough understanding of IAM roles, access management, DNS, load balancing, routing, firewalls, and monitoring tools for cloud and hybrid environments
Experience deploying and supporting AWS network services, including VPC, Subnets, Route Tables, NACLs, Security Groups, TGW, GWLB, VPC Endpoints, Route53.
Knowledge of AWS compute, data sources, security technologies, services including EC2, S3, IAM, ECS,EKS, Load Balancers, SCP, RAM, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, WAF
Experience architecting and securing regulated enterprise-class cloud services with compliance frameworks like SOC2, NIST, and ISO
Experience with logging and monitoring systems like Datadog and Cloudwatch
Are able to reason about large systems - how they work and can be operated on a large scale, edge cases, failure modes, behaviors.
Proficient in writing code/scripting in languages like ( Python, Bash, Powershell)
Automation of infrastructure with CDK, Terraform, and Ansible, as well as containerization using EKS or ECS.
Ability to diagnose complex distributed systems problems whether it be system, network or code
What it’s like to work at ChannelAdvisor, a CommerceHub Company

We take a whole-person approach to engage and support our global team. We believe the diversity of our global team is an advantage. If you’re curious, innovative, determined, and customer-focused, then you’ll love the challenge and rewards of collaborating as a team to help our customers win. We offer competitive compensation programs that recognize your hard work and results. Because when our customers win, we win. And when we win, you win.

We work to create an environment where everyone who is committed, works hard, and delivers results can thrive and grow. You can connect with one of our employee resource groups and support our diversity, equity and inclusion task force, network with like-minded team members, and showcase your leadership skills.

About the job
Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.

Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.

Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest obstacles.

As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.

We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.

Planet is a global company with employees working remotely world wide and joining us from offices in San Francisco, Washington DC, Germany, and The Netherlands.

About The Role

As a security operations engineer you will play a role in all aspects of corporate security, SOC operations, incident handling, user education, and work with the application development teams during design and implementation of the system. You will help manage select critical security systems managed by the Corporate Engineering team. In the role you may also help with other corporate security related work as needs (or interest) arise. This is a hybrid role needing a range of technical and interpersonal skills.

The candidate will need a solid technical software background. This position requires working with different stakeholders, occasional code reviews, and working with developers in addressing security vulnerabilities. The candidate will have knowledge of cryptographic concepts, and be comfortable researching specific topics as needed for the task at hand. Familiarity with networking and Cloud computing systems like GCP or AWS is preferred.

Impact You’ll Own

Run, maintain, monitor, and enhance SIEM, network, server and applications monitoring
Responding to security incidents and Planet’s bug bounty program
Automate workflows and develop solutions to increase the efficiency of the team
Product security reviews
Drive processes and systems to support the success of Planet's products Core Area of Impact 1

What You Bring

Bachelor or a Master of Science degree in an Engineering discipline with a focus on Information Security
Candidates must have a computer science, software engineering, or equivalent technical background, and security concepts including cryptography
Experience developing security requirements at a cross-system level
Experience leading or participating in projects
Experience with SOC operations
Familiarity with network and application penetration testing

What Makes You Stand Out

At least 4-5 years of professional experience in a security focused role
Solid interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Experience with ELK stack
Solid development experience in Python, Go, Ruby, or equivalent in a similar language, and interested to learn other languages as needed

Benefits While Working At Planet

Additional company winter holidays and regular global days off
Remote friendly work environment and flexible working hours
Contribution to our growth by offering equity options for employees
Giving back to the community - one day per quarter for charitable work
Learning and Tuition Reimbursement
Regular hack-weeks and meetup events to exchange knowledge
Home office budget
Employee Resource Groups providing empowering spaces for connection and mentorship

Why We Care So Much About Belonging.

We’re dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. That’s why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our ongoing work with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but you’re thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from around the world who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We don’t just fill positions, we aspire to fulfill people’s careers, most excited about folks who are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope you’re excited to come along for the ride.

About the job
dynexo, ein Unternehmen der DISION Technologies Group, ist spezialisiert auf IT- und Cyber-Security-Lösungen.

Mit einem erfahrenen Team aus Experten bieten wir unseren Kunden individuelle Beratung und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen, um ihre IT-Infrastruktur sicher und geschützt zu halten.

Von der Netzwerksicherheit bis hin zur Cloud-Sicherheit bieten wir ein breites Spektrum an Dienstleistungen, Rund um Security, Informationssicherheit und Datenschutz.

Gemeinsam mit unseren Entwicklungsteams stellen wir sicher, dass Anwendungen, Dienste und Systeme sicher sind und den neuesten Industriestandards entsprechen.

Aufgaben

Wir suchen einen motivierten Junior System Engineer, der sich auf Linux Betriebssysteme und Digitalisierung spezialisiert hat und unser Team bei dynexo unterstützen möchte!

Als System Engineer bei dynexo wirst du verantwortlich sein für die Implementierung und Wartung von Anwendungen, Systemen und Servern, On-Premises und in der Cloud.

Du wirst auch eng mit unseren Entwicklern zusammenarbeiten, Playbooks und Routinen entwicklen, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Anwendungen sicher sind und den neuesten Industriestandards entsprechen.

Um erfolgreich in dieser Rolle zu sein, solltest du ein Verständnis für Linux Systeme, idealerweise auf Basis von RedHat, Ubuntu und Debian haben, sowie Erfahrung in der Implementierung von Lösungen in Cloud-Umgebungen.

Du solltest auch Erfahrung in der Verwendung von Automatisierungswerkzeugen haben, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Systeme und Anwendungen verfügbar und ständig geschützt sind.

Zu deinen Aufgaben gehören:
Aufbau und Konfiguration von IT-Systemen, On-Premises und in der Cloud
Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung von IT-Systemen
Mitwirken an Projekten mit IT-Schwerpunkt
Unterstützung bei der Umsetzung von IT-Lösungen
Fehleranalyse und Troubleshooting

Qualifikation
Studium in der Informatik, Ausbildung oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Kenntnisse und Erfahrung im Umgang mit IT-Systemen
Kenntnisse zu Microsoft Betriebssystemen und Linux
sichere Deutschkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift (C1-Level)
Englischkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift

Benefits
Ein junges, dynamisches, internationales Team, das offen für neue Ideen und Innovationen ist
Eine entspannte Arbeitsumgebung mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Ein familien- und kinderfreundliches Arbeitsumfeld
Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket mit Bonusmöglichkeiten
Ein umfangreiches Benefits-Paket inkl. Dienstrad und betrieblicher Altersvorsorge
Kontinuierliche Schulungen und Fortbildungen
Regelmäßige Firmen-Veranstaltungen und Team-Events

Worauf wartest du noch?

Du hast Leidenschaft für Informatik, Mathematik, Programmierung oder Online-Zocken und hast Lust in einem aufregenden Umfeld zu arbeiten, dann bewirb dich bei uns!

Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen.

About the job
Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.

As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.

At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.

Department Overview

The International Upgrade Operations team sits within the Software & Services business. Our team is responsible for deploying hardware & software upgrades across the mission-critical customer base in order to keep customer systems on current levels of shipping hardware & software.

Job Description

This is an opportunity to join the International Upgrade Operations team as a Systems Engineer (SE). The SE is the technical lead in a customer focused team comprising Project Management, Field Engineering and the system integration teams. The SE has the responsibility for all technical aspects of an assigned hardware upgrade project from kick-off through to system acceptance. The role requires a good knowledge of IP network design & architecture, Public Safety communication systems and strong communication skills.

This role is based from home with occasional travel to an office location. Travel is required for all project phases, from design through to final acceptance

The role involves:
Design and implementation of replacement Public Safety radio communication systems
Optimal implementation & migration planning to minimizing the risk of service disruption to operational mission critical systems
Remote and on site system support for system build and commissioning phases
Technical authority for the system acceptance testing with the customer
Act as the network design authority for internal and external points of contact
Managing demanding timelines to meet customer expectations
Cascade design standards and best practice from other architecture teams & design authorities
Plan and manage multiple projects & parallel work streams
Interface to the customer for meetings, knowledge share & technical point of contact
Create system documentation
Be a strategic thinker who can communicate network concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Continuously apply a lessons learned methodology to improve quality and efficiency

Basic Requirements
Degree or equivalent in Electronic Engineering, Communications Engineering, Telecommunications, related subject or relevant experience
German Language skills
Network specific certifications such as CompTIA Network+, CCNA or equivalent experience
Good understanding of digital communications systems, particularly mobile / cellular radio networks
Knowledge of Public Communication Systems such as TETRA radio system
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to gain trust, build rapport and influence others
Experience directly working with end-user customers is desirable
A genuine interest in IT and communications and how they can be used to maximize an organization's potential and improve the customer experience
Ability to develop effective implementation strategies, consistent with business needs and reduced levels of technical risk ensuring adherence to relevant technical strategies, policies, standards and practices
The ability to troubleshoot complex issues, breaking problems down into component parts to identify and diagnose root causes
Advanced routing & switching knowledge
Have the ability to create network architecture designs
Hands on configuration experience of Firewalls, Routers and Switches
Knowledge of OSPF, BGP, VRRP, IPSEC, VLAN
Experience in creating both high and low level design documentation

Travel Requirements

25-50%

Relocation Provided

None

Position Type

Experienced

Referral Payment Plan

No

About the job
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

Summary
The R&D Engineer II contributes to the development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the R&D Engineer II will collaborate with a team of expert professionals to understand customer requirements and accomplish development objectives. Specifically, the focus of this role will be on the integration of products into the Python ecosystem of scientific and engineering software, e.g. Jupyter Notebooks, NumPy, etc.

Key Duties And Responsibilities
Performs moderately complex development activities, including the design, implementation, maintenance, testing and documentation of software modules and sub-systems.
Understands software engineering (e.g. could read and understand “The Phoenix Project” and make a compelling argument why multi-functional teams are superior to uni-functional teams).
Performs moderately complex bug verification, release testing and beta support for assigned projects. Researches problems discovered by QA or product support and develops solutions.
Understands the marketing requirements for a product, including target environment, performance criteria and competitive issues.
Works under the general supervision of a development manager, but prefers working independently on projects and reports progress over GitHub.

Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience
BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with 2 years’ experience, or MS.
Working experience with Python. Preferably familiar with any compiled language such as C++ or C#. Knowledge of GoLang/Rust will be valued.
Familiar with GitLab/GitHub and CI/CD on public cloud.

Preferred Qualifications And Skills
Experience with Python ecosystem (i.e., NumPy, Scipy, Pandas, matplotlib, VTK, etc.).
Experience with the microservices concept.
Experience with CAE products, machine learning, or applied software development in the field of engineering.
Maintains one or more open-source projects on GitHub.
Experience in a large-scale commercial software development environment.
Req: 11825

Our Values Are Crucial For Fostering a Culture Of Winning For Our Company
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs.

WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it’s about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished”. It’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.
At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost.
