About the job
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is the 3rd most-cited and 6th largest research publisher and we publish groundbreaking discoveries by the world's top experts.

Scientists empower society and our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery by making science open. We place the researcher at the center of everything we do and enable the research community to develop the solutions we need to live healthy lives on a healthy planet.

Join the publishing revolution.

About The Role

The Audience Strategy team is seeking strong Data Analysts with an interest in commercial/ marketing insights and a strong background in (social) data science to understand, build and optimise our growth strategies and support the marketing automation effort across the company.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in allowing us to create value from our different data sets, by way of in-depth analysis of marketing data, visualisation of results, segmenting and understanding our audiences so we can tailor the perfect experience to them.

You will be turning data into actionable insights according to business and marketing requirements, analyzing customer behaviour, touch points and providing integrated dashboards. All while ensuring data quality to provide improvement to business processes and impact decision-making.

What You Will Be Doing
Work with data streams to bring in the needed data and insights to our CRM and our campaigns.
Query our database to create new audience segments and coordinate with the journey team to create customer journeys for them.
Implement and optimize CRM audience segmentation for growth.
Define and conceptualise scoring and tagging systems.
Work with the Marketing Automation teams to build successful campaigns and create a seamless researcher experience.
Manage data analysis and reporting of our marketing automation and CRM integrations.
Support measurement and campaign effectiveness, generating audience insights using closed-loop reporting between our marketing automation platform, data reporting tool and Salesforce.
Monitor the performance (dashboards and publishing monitoring KPIs), forecast performance through predictive analytics, and recommend remedial actions through prescriptive analytics.
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting, defining measurement requirements.

About You

Must haves:
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a data analytics, business intelligence or similar role, ideally working on marketing projects.
Experience building audiences for retargeting, nurturing and growth.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL (BigQuery) and working with large data sets.
Expert knowledge of Tableau and other data visualisation tools, preferably in the Salesforce ecosystem.
Strong understanding of the marketing tech stack (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CDP, Pardot, Google 360, Advertising Studio…).
Strong understanding of how databases work, types of data, types of relations…
High level of personal initiative and very good strategic and analytical skills.
Excellent communications skills and ability to simplify advanced statistical concepts for a layman audience.
Ability to produce clear and concise data-driven reports and presentations.
Ability to liaise with data engineers.
Fluency in verbal and written English.

Preferable:
Desirable 3+ years of experience working with digital marketing data and marketing automation platforms (Pardot, Marketing Cloud, Advertising Studio).
Basic experience with data sources integration with Salesforce Customer Data Platform.
Basic knowledge of Saleswings and Google Analytics 360 for behavioural analysis.
Working knowledge of integration and data flow between marketing systems and Salesforce.
Working knowledge of APIs, data connectors, and other pipelines.
Experience in marketing operations for technology products.
Data modelling capability with large data sets leveraging an established BI solution (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, CRM Analytics).
Certified in Einstein Analytics is a nice to have.

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

About the job
Über MEDIFOX DAN
Wir verfolgen ein Ziel – die Digitalisierung der Pflege. Mit uns sollen Pflegekräfte mehr Zeit für das Wesentliche haben. Anders gesagt: Wir helfen Menschen, Menschen zu helfen.
Von Stammdatenverwaltung über Touren- und Dienstplanung bis hin zur mobilen Datenerfassung decken wir den kompletten Softwarebedarf einer Pflegeeinrichtung ab. Tagtäglich werden unsere Anwendungen auf über 50.000 Geräten genutzt. Wir bedienen dabei sowohl Android- als auch iOS-basierte Plattformen und bieten darüber hinaus windows-basierte PC-Lösungen sowie eine web-basierte Cloudlösung an.

Zur Verstärkung unseres bestehenden Teams suchen wir Dich als

Junior Security Analyst (m/w/d)

Die MEDIFOX DAN IT-Abteilung ist für den reibungslosen Betrieb aller Systeme und Tools in der Cloud und on premise verantwortlich. Wir supporten die Anwender und stellen den Teams und Abteilungen eine bestmögliche Arbeitsumgebung an allen Standorten bereit. Darüber hinaus sorgen wir für stetigen Fortschritt in der Systemlandschaft und optimieren diese kontinuierlich hinsichtlich Funktionalität, Performance und Sicherheit.
Wir sind verantwortlich für die Cybersecurity aller Unternehmen der MEDIFOX DAN Gruppe und betrachten dabei die gesamte Bandbreite von organisatorischen Maßnahmen bis hin zu technischen Controls. Hierfür setzen wir auf moderne Tools und Anbieter zur Identifikation, Analyse und Abwehr von Bedrohungen.
Zu unseren Aufgaben gehören neben der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung der Sicherheit für unsere Unternehmen und Produkte durch Einführung, Benutzung und Überwachung von technischen und organisatorischen Maßnahmen auch die Schulung von Mitarbeitern sowie die Erstellung und Überarbeitung von Richtlinien. An einem gewöhnlichen Arbeitstag kannst du ein Cybersecurity Assessment durchführen, Logfiles im Rahmen eines Incidents analysieren, auf gemeldete Phishingmails reagieren und diese mit Hilfe unserer Tools bewerten..

Dein Aufgabenbereich
Identifikation von Risiken und Gegenmaßnahmen unter Zuhilfenahme des Toolsets (Monitoring, SIEM, AV etc.)
Konzeption von Maßnahmen zur Verbesserung der Cybersecurity
Du arbeitest eng mit dem IT Consulting und dem 2nd Level bei der Umsetzung von Anforderungen, Maßnahmen und Projekten zusammen
Audits, Beratung und Unterstützung aller Unternehmen, Abteilungen und Teams
Begleiten und Nachverfolgen von Security Incidents
Entwicklung und Durchführung von Simulationen und Trainings
Verfassen von Richtlinien, Anweisungen und Sicherstellung der Einhaltung


Das bringst Du mit
Kenntnisse über aktuelle Angriffsmethoden und Einsatzszenarien für Gegenmaßnahmen
Kenntnisse über Standards wie ISO 27001, BSI 200-*, NIST
Gerne Spezialisierung auf technische oder organisatorische Maßnahmen (z. B. Awarenessmaßnahmen)
Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch
Bereitschaft zum Lernen und hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein
Bonuspunkte: Kenntnisse und Erfahrung im Bereich des Datenschutzes, Erfahrung in Scripting und Programmierung auf Shell-Ebene

Das bieten wir Dir
Wir bieten Dir flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit deutschlandweit im Homeoffice zu arbeiten
Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket sowie Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Ein unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag sowie Möglichkeiten einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge warten auf Dich
Eine fundierte Einarbeitung ist uns wichtig – Du erhältst zu Beginn eine umfassende Schulung und lernst alle wichtigen Ansprechpartner:innen kennen, um bestmöglich vorbereitet zu sein
Wir unterstützen Dich bei Deinen Karrierezielen und entwickeln gemeinsam Deine Potenziale
Wir bieten ein Jobrad®-Fahrradleasing nach dem Dienstrad-Konzept

Nutzung von Corporate Benefits

About the job
Wil jij zelf de keuze hebben bij wat voor opdrachtgever je gaat werken en wil je uitgedaagd worden door complexe datavraagstukken?
Als Data Engineer bij DataDolphins heb je zelf de keuze welk project het beste past bij jouw ervaring en ambitie!

Wat ga je doen?
Je gaat jouw expertise voor bepaalde tijd inbrengen bij één van onze opdrachtgevers en je gaat ze helpen een concreet datavraagstuk aan te pakken. Voor jou als ervaren Data Engineer zijn dit uiteraard uitdagende projecten met een grote ontwikkelcomponent. Onze opdrachtgevers zijn over algemeen de grotere

Zo biedt DataDolphins jou de mogelijkheid om vanuit één baan geregeld te wisselen van werkomgeving én te zorgen voor een continue en steile leercurve.

Dit krijg je bij ons
Bij DataDolphins werken we volgens het midlance-model. Dit betekent dat je een eerlijke en bovengemiddelde beloning krijgt. Maar ook de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn uitstekend geregeld, zoals: onbeperkt verlof , onkosten- en reiskostenvergoeding en we investeren samen in opleiding en training. Naast aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden krijg je bij ons veel vrijheid en regie op je eigen carrière. Wij zoeken geen collega bij een project maar wij zoeken een passend project voor onze collega's.

Waar staan wij voor?
Bij DataDolphins maak je onderdeel uit van een warme, informele, en platte organisatie met gelijkgestemde vakgenoten waarin jouw belang en ontwikkeling voorop staat.
Dat doen we door veel kennis te delen, ons gezamenlijke netwerk te gebruiken om nieuwe projecten en collega’s te vinden en natuurlijk plezier met elkaar te hebben. Ieder kwartaal is er een informeel uitje en afgelopen september hebben we met hele bedrijf ons uitgebreid gevierd op Texel.

“Ik voel me heel vrij bij deze club vakgenoten. Het contact met de Business Managers is goed want er wordt geregeld tijd vrijgemaakt voor een lunch om bij te praten. Daarnaast is het salaris ook zeker niet verkeerd.”

Klinkt goed! Wat verwachten jullie van mij?
We willen graag dat jij als Data Engineer succesvol wordt bij DataDolphins, daarvoor zijn een aantal zaken essentieel:

Je hebt een hbo- of academisch werk- en denkniveau
Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in data engineering
Je hebt ervaring met talen als Python en/ of SQL
Je hebt kennis van/ ervaring met één of meer van de cloud platformen Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services en Google Cloud
Je vindt het interessant om te werken met moderne technologieën als Spark, Kafka, Kubernetes, Docker en Snowflake
Je hebt uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal
Je bent enthousiast over jouw vakgebied en vindt het leuk om daar over te vertellen
Je bent flexibel en je houdt van afwisseling
Je vindt het belangrijk om je te blijven ontwikkelen

Ik wil meer weten, hoe gaat het in zijn werk?
Bij DataDolphins zijn de lijnen kort, ook in de sollicitatieprocedure. Nadat we jouw CV hebben ontvangen neemt één van onze Business Managers, binnen 2 werkdagen contact met je op. Als jouw cv ons aanspreekt plannen we direct een persoonlijke kennismaking met je in.
Liever eerst even contact? Neem dan contact op met Annelien Gijzen via 06 45412403, een appje sturen mag ook. Hopelijk tot snel!

About Fandom

Fandom is the world's largest fan platform where fans immerse themselves in imagined worlds across entertainment and gaming. Reaching more than 350 million unique visitors per month and hosting more than 250,000 wikis, Fandom.com is the #1 source for in-depth information on pop culture, gaming, TV and film, where fans learn about and celebrate their favorite fandoms.

Fandom is an equal opportunity employer. Fandom values diversity, and all employment decisions are made on the basis of job requirements and individual qualifications.

About the job
Why are you looking for a job?

If your answer ticks all the boxes, then maybe we can work together.
You have a curious mind - You won't understand what we're talking about if you don’t. 🤯
You want to learn things about technology - You won't survive if you don’t. 😱
You have many ideas that can become products - You'll be the boss of your ideas. 🕺
You want to make the world a bit better - We don’t like you if you don’t. 🤬

We happen to be just like that as well. We like hacking things here and there (you included, don't give us a reason to do so 😇) and creating scalable solutions that bring value to the world. No bosses, no pressure, no bullshit 💩. Just fun and teamwork. If you tick the above, then keep reading.

Squaredev?

We build great software! 💪 We use state-of-the-art technology to build solutions for our own customers and for the customers of our partners. We make sure we stay the best in class by contributing to research projects, where we collaborate with high-end partners across Europe.
Furthermore, we heavily invest in our team and trainings. We want to become a great company with the best team!

What you need to bring to the table

Learning attitude. We all have strong minds, as long as we work out the right muscles. 🤓
An impact on our culture and solutions. You need to speak up. Loud. You are part of this. 🗣️
Your fresh ideas that can grow in scalable products - We'll help with that… but remember… you asked for it. 💡
Your failures. Yeah, you read it right. Everyone fails. Get used to it. Learn from it. Wear it as a badge. 💪
A smile during our morning stand-up. If you don’t feel like working today, then don't. Literally! 😁

Let's go technical and get serious
All the below are nice-to-haves. The requirements are simple. Being able to create an E2E application with Javascript - React, Nodejs, Mongodb (or any database).

At least 2 years of experience using React & Typescript.
APIs with nodejs or python. Know how to create one, design the routes RESTfully, deploy it, etc.
Databases. Set up, basic operations, index it and so on.
Linux / Unix. Helps a lot.
Git. No explanations needed.
For the more advanced out there, we have a lot more goodies to play with.
DevOps and CICD: Kubernetes, servers, deployments, and so on.
Architecture: Message queues, logging & monitoring …

What we offer:
Opportunities to build your career in the direction you want (technical and non-technical).
Remote working environment.
5 extra holidays to spend with your family and friends.
The Annual Squaredev Party 🎉 .
Books & courses. Squaredev can buy them for you so you can feed your curious mind.
Competitive compensation package.
A new Apple MacBook Pro.

How to apply?
Apply directly via this platform, and we will reach out to you!

Conclusion
Well, that’s it. Apply if you like our spirit (don't if you don't 👊). Also, feedback and questions are welcome. We want to become better and learn from you, whether you want to join or you're in the mood to help. Thanks for your time reading this. Looking forward to hearing from you. 🙃

About the job
Our success is reliant on building teams that include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can elevate assumptions and ideas with fresh perspectives. We're dedicated to hiring the whole human, not just a resume. To that end, we look for a diverse pool of applicants-including those from historically marginalized groups. We would like to invite you to apply even if you don't think you meet all of the requirements listed below. We don't want a few lines in a job description to get between us and the opportunity to meet you.

The Role

As an Analytics Engineer at Outreach.io, you will drive the success of Outreach’s Analytics and Operational programs through the production, documentation, and curation of certified data sources and models. You practice scalable coding practices, write efficient SQL, and document your work so that future stakeholders will already have their questions answered. You are the “T” in ELT (Extract-Load-Transform), and turn the data pipelines from our Data Engineering teams into useful models for our Analytics and self service Data Champions to adopt and answer their own business questions.

Overall, you make Data at Outreach a more trusted, governed, and powerful asset for all employees.

About The Team

The Analytics Engineering team is dedicated to the empowerment of all people through the use of scalable and trusted data sets. We drive alignment on core business metrics and enable other teams to experiment with novel operational metrics to track the business. The AE team is a subset of the Business Intelligence & Analytics team, and partners across the org to drive education and enablement for all employees.

Your Daily Adventures Will Include

Model and document new datasets (both structured and semi-structured) to exploit the value therein across all our business units
Partner with subject matter experts to document, align and automate business metrics that define success
Work with Analysts to optimize their use of data, either through query reviews, modeling exercises, or dashboard audits
Own the design, monitoring, and deployment of certified data sources on our reporting platforms and warehouses
Insist on the highest standards for data reproducibility, audibility and compliance
Serve as a subject matter expert for data strategy thought leadership and implementation across the business
Enable non-BI&A team stakeholders to adopt data as part of their business and usual
Implement data strategy in dbt models
Be the subject matter expert and main point of contact for Tableau on premise to Cloud migration project

Our Vision of You

2+ years relevant experience with the ability to communicate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner to audiences from fellow analysts to senior executive level. Experience working with business stakeholders for requirements gathering and documentation, and follow code documentation best practices.
An effective storyteller with an emphasis on visual best practices and discoverability. Participates in the sharing of knowledge with Analytic and non-analytical teams alike.
Familiar with Snowflake, dbt (core), airflow, Tableau and Strong SQL (Snowflake preferred) knowledge:
- Consistently combines data across systems and data warehouses
- Has a solid understanding of relational databases
- Follows best SQL practices with clear CTEs and avoids unnecessary joins and columns
With guidance, model and document new datasets (both structured and semi-structured) that are applicable to a business partner.
History of Query and Data Pipeline optimization.
Knowledge of multi-dimensional data modeling.
Ideal candidates also have experience with Python and knowledge of migration from server environment to a cloud based environment.

Why You’ll Love It Here

Highly competitive salary
Amazing working space with a running track on its roof
Flexible time off, 5 weeks of vacation, and 5 annual sick days
4% employer supplemental pension monthly contribution
Private medical care for employee and spouse with Program Health Plus
Life insurance at 2x annual salary
5.000 CZK monthly allowance for meal vouchers, flexipasses and other personal expenses
16 weeks of annual top up maternity leave pay or 8 weeks of fully paid paternity leave
Opportunity to be part of company success via the RSU program
Company-organized and personal paid volunteer days to support the community that supports us
Relocation package - support offered for foreign future employees and their families relocating to Prague
Diversity and inclusion programs that promote employee resource groups like OWN (Outreach Women's Network), AAPI, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Gender+, LatinX, Black Excellence, Disability Community, and Veterans
Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team
Fun company and team outings because we play just as hard as we work

About the job
Job Description

Wir bei sevDesk

Auch wir bei sevDesk kennen keine universelle Glücksformel für die Arbeitswelt. Aber gemeinsam arbeiten wir täglich daran, zu verstehen, was genau das Glücksgefühl unserer sevFamily dauerhaft steigern kann. Eines ist schon mal sicher: Bei uns kannst du genau so sein, wie du bist und so arbeiten, wie es zu dir passt! Nicht die Arbeit definiert uns, sondern wir die Arbeit! Unsere Kultur ist keine Kunst. Sie ist echt.

Sei du selbst bei sevDesk - BE YOURSEV!

Deine Mission:

Du ermöglichst deinem Team noch bessere und datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen. Dies gelingt dir, indem du unsere Dateninfrastruktur im Hintergrund am Laufen hältst, beständig verbesserst und so die Arbeit für alle einfacher machst.

Hier bist du dabei:
Du erweiterst unser Data Warehouse mit modellierten Daten und optimierst kontinuierlich bestehende Datenmodelle.
Du bist verantwortlich für die qualitativ hochwertige Datenaufbereitung und -analyse mit SQL.
Du unterstützt Kolleg:innen durch eine rationale, datenbasierte Beratung bei Entscheidungen sowie bei der Weiterentwicklung von KPIs und sorgst dafür, dass Entscheidungsprozesse dadurch noch schneller und besser werden.
Du stellst Analysen und Forecasts als Charts und Dashboards auf unserem Business Intelligence Tool bereit und sorgst dafür, dass das Team Zugang dazu hat.

Das bringst du mit:
Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik, BWL, oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs.
Du hast mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung in der Rolle als Analyst, Data Engineer oder in der Entwicklung von Software-Produkten.
Du bringst mindestens 3 Jahre an Erfahrung mit SQL und Datenbanken mit (wir nutzen Redshift) und hast keine Berührungsängste, wenn es um Programmiersprachen geht. Idealerweise hast du schon Erfahrung mit Python, R oder JavaScript gesammelt.
Du bist mit Business Intelligence Tools (wir nutzen Looker) und Datenmodellierung (wir nutzen dbt) vertraut.
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und Englisch und hast einen Wohnsitz in Deutschland.

__

Unser TechStack

Python | SQL | ELT | Singer/Stitch | AWS / Redshift | CI/CD | DevOps

Job Requirements

Unsere Benefits – Dein sevDesk

Deine Freiheit: Arbeite, wo du willst. Unser deutschlandweites Remote-Konzept macht es möglich.

Deine Flexibilität: Arbeite, wann es am produktivsten für dich ist, Hauptsache als Teamplayer:in.

Deine Projekte: Sei kreativ im Open Code Friday und setze ein eigenes Projekt um!

Deine Ideen: Bringe dich mit eigenen Ideen ein und gestalte sevDesk aktiv mit. Jeder Beitrag zählt.

Deine Weiterbildung: Bücherflat und Brown Bag Session – Wissensaustausch feiern wir.

Deine Karriere: Wir fordern und fördern dich auf deinem individuellen Weg.

Dein Team: Ob off- oder online, ob bei Events oder auf Slack – im Team ist alles besser.

Deine Ausstattung: Such dir deine Hardware selbst aus. Bei Bedarf gibt es Tisch und Stuhl on top.

Deine Goodies: Du erhältst pro Monat einen Gutschein z.B. zum Shoppen oder Tanken.

Dein Anteil: Werde selbst Unternehmer:in durch unser Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm

Dein Traumrad: Tritt in die Pedale und hol dir dein Wunschrad über unser Bikeleasing-Programm.

Dein Dresscode: Blazer oder Jogginghose – bei uns sorgen Outfits für Inspiration statt Empörung.

Deine Vorsorge: Wir bezuschussen die Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und packen 30€ obendrauf.

Dein Vorteil: Du erhältst dank Corporate Benefits bei über 600 Partner-Unternehmen Rabatte.

Deine Reisen: Für unsere Remoties sind Reisekosten ins Office nach Offenburg abgedeckt.

Dein Engagement: Nutze 3 Arbeitstage im Jahr, um dich sozial oder für die Umwelt zu engagieren.

Deine Erholung: Gönn dir 30 Urlaubstage im Jahr, um dich richtig entspannen zu können.

Besuche uns auf Instagram, um mehr Einblicke zu erhalten.

Kontaktperson:  Tini Masuch

About the job
The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That’s where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world’s most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.

The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That’s where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world’s most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.

Software Engineers in the data platform and clustering teams strike a balance between forward-looking software engineering best practices, and data engineering infrastructure know-how. This team partners with data scientists, research and product teams, helping architect, create and maintain data pipelines. Software Engineers in the data platform and Clustering teams have a deep understanding of blockchain data, are experts at understanding protocol schemas and nuances, build scalable AWS ingest pipelines, lambdas and services. We measure success by the coverage of data clustered for the various Chainalysis products.

In one year you’ll know you were successful if…

Built scalable ETL/ELT pipelines for clustering
Created tools to apply different attributes and heuristics to clustering
Worked with our product teams to ensure accurate data is provided to our customers
Increased coverage of clustering
Contributed to the effectiveness and velocity of team deliverables
You have learned new technologies and shown that you are not afraid to work outside your comfort zone

A Background Like This Helps

Solid understanding of building data pipelines, lakes and streaming services
Some work experience with AWS tools such as S3, Lambdas, and CDKs
Experience with running batch and streaming based ETL/ELT pipelines in production
Understanding of efficient data structures, algorithms and computational complexity
Planned, built, and owned production systems
Experience with Python, Java, and/or Typescript
The versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job
The ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences
Bias for action

The Following Would Differentiate You

Experience with cloud environments (AWS, GCP, etc)
Knowledge of blockchain technologies and protocols

At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.

You belong here.

At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women’s Day, Harvey Milk Day, World Humanitarian Day, and UN International Migrants Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.

We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can’t wait to meet you.

About the job
Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.

Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.

Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest obstacles.

As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.

We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.

Planet is a global company with employees working remotely world wide and joining us from offices in San Francisco, Washington DC, Germany, and The Netherlands.

About The Role

We are seeking an Analytics Engineer to join our Geospatial Data Support team in Berlin. Our team has built a geospatial data infrastructure from end to end to deliver data products in the form of apps, spreadsheets, dashboards and maps to several data consumers such as satellite tasking and product engineers, and customer success managers to understand our satellite collection performance and order fulfillment. This role will support the effort to get our data in shape, ready to be consumed and used by data analysts inside and outside our team.

Impact You’ll Own

Build and maintain geospatial data models, made from satellite telemetry to image footprints metadata
Perform geospatial analysis in order to answer complex questions about the intersection of space, tech, geography and business
Implement a semantic layer, building dbt pipelines from end to end, ending up with metrics that will be easily consumed by data analysis and applications

What You Bring

Advanced SQL knowledge
Analytics and data modeling skills, demonstrated via prior projects.
Experience with dbt (preferably 1+ years)
Experience working with git, Gitlab or Github
Adaptability and openness to changes and challenges
A positive, can-do attitude to work
Collaboration with various stakeholders
Empathy and understanding the data consumers’ requirements

What Makes You Stand Out

Experience working with geospatial SQL functions in PostGIS
Experience working with spatial aggregations and visualization such as H3
Experience building semantic data models
Google Cloud Platform knowledge, especially BigQuery

Benefits While Working At Planet

Additional company winter holidays and regular global days off
Remote friendly work environment and flexible working hours
Contribution to our growth by offering equity options for employees
Giving back to the community - one day per quarter for charitable work
Learning and Tuition Reimbursement
Regular hack-weeks and meetup events to exchange knowledge
Home office budget
Employee Resource Groups providing empowering spaces for connection and mentorship

Why We Care So Much About Belonging.

We’re dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. That’s why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our ongoing work with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but you’re thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from around the world who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We don’t just fill positions, we aspire to fulfill people’s careers, most excited about folks who are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope you’re excited to come along for the ride.

EEO Statement

Planet is committed to building a community where everyone belongs and we invite people from all backgrounds to apply. Planet is an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Accommodations

Planet is an inclusive community and we know that everyone has their own needs. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation during the interview process, please call Planet's front office at 669-214-9404 or contact your recruiter with your request. Your message will be confidential and we will be happy to assist you.

About the job
Description

Analytics Engineer - MarTech

We are looking for an Analytics Engineer with expertise in MarTech (Marketing Technology) to join our team. As an Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our marketing data infrastructure, and enabling data-driven decisions across the Marketing organisation. Part of the MarTech team, you will work closely with the Marketing and Data Engineering teams to develop data pipelines, automate data processes, and build dashboards and reports that provide insights into the performance of Marketing Campaigns and Channels.

You Will Be Responsible For
Work closely with Marketing teams to understand their data and insights needs, and design and build data pipelines that enable data-driven decision making across the organisation
Build and maintain the data infrastructure that supports marketing analytics, including data warehouses, ETL processes, and data visualisation tools
Develop and automate data processes that ensure data accuracy and consistency across different systems and platforms
Build dashboards and reports that provide insights into the performance of marketing campaigns and channels, and enable marketing teams to optimise their efforts
Work closely with our central data and analytics engineering teams to ensure data quality, scalability, and reliability of the marketing data infrastructure
Keep up-to-date with industry trends and technologies in MarTech and Analytics, and contribute to the development of best practices and standards

About You
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong experience with data warehouses, ETL processes, and data visualisation tools
SQL experience for manipulation and analysis. Experience in other data languages (R, Python) is a plus
At least 3+ years of experience in data engineering or analytics, with a focus on MarTech or experience working with marketing data, and understanding of marketing channels and campaigns
Prior experience modelling data in LookML and DBT is nice to have
Excellent communication skills and ability to bridge the data gap between Marketing and Data Engineering

About the job
Si te apasiona la moda sport y el deporte, en ISRG tenemos mucho que ofrecerte: te damos la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera en el grupo líder del retail deportivo multimarca en España, Portugal y Países Bajos, en un proyecto en constante crecimiento y un entorno basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo, con un fuerte compromiso por la diversidad y la igualdad de oportunidades.

Gracias a Sprinter, JD Sports, Sport Zone, Size?, Perrysport, Aktiesport, Bodytone y Deporvillage, contamos con más de 500 tiendas y 10.000 personas que forman parte de esta familia en constante expansión internacional.

Nuestros procesos de selección tienen como objetivo identificar el mejor talento y motivación, con un modelo de gestión por competencias, donde valoramos muy positivamente las experiencias de voluntariado, sociales y del ámbito doméstico.

¿Te unes al equipo?

Misión:

Como Data Analyst te encargará de mantener las herramientas del área de negocio de merchandising, revisar de forma sistemática los resultados de las ejecuciones, atender las peticiones de las personas usuarias de negocio, localizar cualquier incidencia/área de mejora y trasladar las peticiones (una vez calificadas) a los equipos de trabajo.

Funciones:
Diseño y elaboración de KPIs específicos requeridos por negocio y/o la matriz del grupo. (P.ejm: Velocidad Venta Producto Tienda Vs Web)
Realizar/mantener modelos de previsión de demanda, para ayudar al equipo de Merchandising/Compras a estimar las cantidades necesarias.
Análisis del histórico de la BBDD con alto volumen de datos con el objetivo de generar modelos de predicción en las áreas requeridas.
Análisis de producto (ciclo de vida del pricing, márgenes, etc…)
Análisis y segmentación del tipo de cliente (CRM) con el objetivo de ayudar al departamento de Marketing a realizar acciones dirigidas.
Ajuste y mejora del algoritmo de reposición y cobertura de Stock.
Soporte técnico de programas informáticos relacionados con la gestión de stock y pricing de productos, basados en Machine Learning (predicción de la demanda, segmentación, pricing, optimización ).
Elaboración de cuadros de mando para la toma de decisiones a nivel corporativo.
Identificación de áreas de mejora.
Supervisión diaria de resultados.
Desarrollos incrementales a las aplicaciones en producción.
Resolución de incidencias.
Trasladar las peticiones, incidencias y/o mejoras al departamento de Proyectos y Operaciones para la puesta en producción de las mismas.

Requisitos:
Grado, Diplomatura o Licenciatura en estadística, matemáticas, Ingeniería informática o en estudios similares
Tener conocimientos de SQL avanzado.
Nivel muy alto en SAS.
Python Avanzado.
Conocimiento en SAP.
Buen nivel de inglés (B2).
Experiencia mínima de al menos 2 años en puesto similar.

Valorable:
Valorable Python u otros lenguajes de programación.
Nivel alto de otras lenguas: italiano, francés, portugués, holandés…

Desde el grupo ISRG ofrecemos un entorno basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo, con un fuerte compromiso por la diversidad y la igualdad de oportunidades. Todas las personas serán consideradas sin importar su identidad de género, orientación sexual, etnia, religión, edad o grado de discapacidad.

Nuestros procesos de selección están basados en el modelo de evaluación por competencias profesionales y valoramos la pasión, ganas de aprender y de crecer en un entorno internacional.

¿Qué más ofrecemos?
Porcentaje sobre objetivos.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Teletrabajo posible.
Bonificación fiscal/flexible (seguro médico, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería).
Descuento empleado/a.
Plan de desarrollo personalizado y carrera en un entorno internacional.
Formación continua tanto en hard skills y soft skills.

About the job
At Prima we are revolutionizing the insurance world, starting with two fundamental pillars: data and the technology to harness it.
The speed and dynamism of the industry in which we operate requires us to continually make real-time decisions, such as pricing coverage for a specific user or the need for a fraud check for a reported claim. Almost all of these decisions are made automatically by dynamic systems and artificial intelligence engines that estimate the probability of future events and define the best possible action for Prima and its customers.

As a Data Scientist you will aim to teach our platform to make the best decisions in a variety of different contexts and, in general, to extract as much value as possible from our data assets. Your work will directly impact the growth and sustainability of our company, contributing to the achievement of our strategic goals.
At Prima you will find the right environment to grow, learning a lot from colleagues and having the opportunity to make your mark. You will quickly gain operational autonomy and full recognition for your efforts.

Requirements
You are our ideal candidate if you meet these requirements:

Excellent academic achievements
You have earned a master or doctoral degree in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering Mathematics, Engineering Physics, Statistics. No prior work experience is necessary, we will invest in your talent and education.

Quantitative, logical and analytical skills
You quickly master very complex topics, whatever the field. You have great attention to detail and can intuit and model the mathematical dynamics that drive the phenomena around you, grasping the cause and effect relationships between the forces at work. In Prima you will find stimulating and varied challenges that will test all your skills.

Curiosity, passion and pragmatism
You take a critical look at the world around you and always ask "why?" You think about how to improve things and fight to realize your ideas. You have a practical result-oriented spirit and can identify the most effective way to achieve it. We will encourage you to pursue common goals in an original and innovative way, advancing your ideas and proactively generating value.

In addition to the basic requirements, we will pay special attention to these characteristics:
You have had international experience and speak fluent English
You have a solid foundation in programming and algorithm implementation, especially machine learning
You know how to create and manipulate datasets using data mining languages (such as MySQL or Redshift)

Research shows that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. At Prima we are committed to building diverse teams so please apply even if your past experience doesn't align perfectly with the requirements. You might still be a great fit!
Benefits
We will give you everything you need to express your talents and work at your best:
Innovative, informal environment
State-of-the-art devices and tools
Ongoing training (internal and external)
Welfare plan and company benefits
Team building events
We will evaluate salary and duration at the interview stage to ensure you receive an offer that matches your experience and expertise.
Working hours are Full Time and our contracts are regulated by the CCNL of Commerce.
Our office is in Piazzale Loreto 17, 20131 Milano (MI), but we also consider Full Remote hiring from other European countries and for our offices in Rome, London and Madrid.
-
Prima offers equal employment opportunities and is oriented toward diversity and inclusion in the workplace. The company prohibits discrimination of any kind based on race, color, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

About the job
Neon is an open-source company on a mission to build the open-source Postgres data layer that gives developers the freedom to create on the modern web. We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to derive deeper product and revenue insights from our fast-growing user base. You will:
Build out informative data visualisations as part of our BI dashboards to support a cross-functional base of teams
Collaborate with the Data Engineer to ensure data is drawn into our data warehouse from the sources that hold the data required for the insights teams seek to derive
Collect, clean and interpret data sets on a daily basis in order to get product and business insights

We’re looking for someone who has:
5+ years of experience, it's a mid/senior level role
Good understanding of advanced SQL techniques
Deep Experience developing dashboards using BI tools such as Superset, Metabase, Redash, Looker (Data Studio), Tableau, etc.
Experience using Python (good scripting skills)
Demonstrated knowledge for creating data visualisations required for specific business functions; Revenue, Product, Operations etc.
Strong ability to prioritise and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike
Ability to turn data from the analysis to turn information into actionable findings through reports, dashboards, and/or presentations
Experience working with product and engineering teams

It would be great if you have:
Experience with data analytics for technical, infrastructure products & products and products for devs
Experience working with commercial organisations (e.g., Sales, Marketing, Account Management, Support, etc.)
Experience designing and running experiments to drive business and product insights (e.g. A/B tests)

Our Investors
Top-tier investors backed up Neon's vision:
We raised $54.3m from GGV Capital, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst, Founders Fund
Our angels investors are prominent technologists, and ecosystem players. More than 20 awesome angels supported Neon, including Nat Friedman, Elad Gil, Mike Ovitz, Ajeet Singh, Guillermo Rauch, Søren Brammer Schmidt, and Wes McKinney
Our Board includes Quentin Clark, Glenn Solomon, Joe Morrissey, and Leigh Marie Braswell

Our Offer
You have an opportunity to be an early employee in the fast-scaling ambitious team
You can work 100% remote: we'll handle all formalities to arrange work from your home
We pay top of the market in most parts of the world
We grant equity (stock options) for all full-time hires
We offer a competitive benefits package in line with all tech companies (top-notch equipment, unlimited vacations, paid parental leaves, and much more)
We are distributed, yet make our bonds during regular offsites (the last one was in Cyprus)

Our Hiring Process

We like to keep things and get awesome people fast. We aim to complete a hiring process within a week from the moment we review your application.
The entire hiring process is fully remote.
Once you have submitted your CV, our team will review it, and we can contact you to schedule an initial call with a recruiter
If we move on to the next steps, you will have two 1:1 calls with our team members and a culture-add interview.
We will also ask you to do a lightweight home assignment to evaluate your technical skills
Once all the interviews are over, our team will swiftly analyze the results of all the steps and present the final decision.

About the job
We are looking for a Data Engineer responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure and systems that enable the collection, storage, and analysis of large sets of data. This can include tasks such as creating and optimizing data pipelines, designing and implementing data storage solutions, and ensuring data quality and security. Will often work closely with Data Scientists and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and design solutions that meet those needs. Strong technical skills, particularly in programming and database management, are typically required for this role.

Data Engineer mandatory skills and experience
Some essential skills and experience for a Data Engineer include:

Strong programming skills, particularly in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.

Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Apache Kafka.

Proficiency in SQL and experience with database management systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.

Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.

Understanding of data warehousing concepts and data modeling techniques.

Knowledge of data integration, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) processes.

Experience with data governance and data security best practices.

Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and debug complex systems.

Excellent communication skills, as Data Engineers often need to work closely with other teams and stakeholders.

Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and experience working in a collaborative, cross-functional environment.

Having experience with Machine Learning or Data Science is a plus but not mandatory for the role of Data Engineer.

About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions

What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

About the job
About OutSystems

OutSystems is the pioneer of the fast-growing high-performance low-code development market. The company empowers organizations to innovate their businesses through software, and we are looking for talented and motivated individuals to join our team.

The OutSystems high-performance low-code platform is considered one of the leading application development solutions by customers, analysts such as Gartner and Forrester, and partners around the world. The platform gives organizations – from small and mid-sized businesses to enterprises – the tools to build, deliver, manage and evolve mobile and web applications that are unique to their businesses. With high-productivity, AI-assisted tools, customers can tackle any strategic challenge – from modernizing and integrating their existing applications, to automating business and workplace processes, and creating exceptional customer apps and experiences. Solutions built with OutSystems are secure, resilient, cloud-native, built to scale, and can be continuously evolved.

OutSystems is a truly global organization, with customers across 87 countries and 22 industries, more than 400 partners, and a 600,000-developer community. The company is known for creating a culture of innovation inside its customer organizations, with many working with OutSystems for more than a decade.

Founded in 2001 in Portugal, we have offices in Lisbon, the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Germany, France, the UAE, India, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, and Australia, and of course a thriving and collaborative worldwide community of remote employees. OutSystems continuously receives leadership recognition from the top analyst firms, the CODiE Awards, SD Times 100, the Cloud100, and other influential groups.

Our team members are at the core of a dynamic, industry-leading company that is helping organizations of all sizes across the globe innovate their businesses through the power of software.

Do you love technology that solves problems? Do you feel accomplished by helping others achieve their full potential? At OutSystems, the Digital department is responsible for accelerating the company to the next level. We build applications using our platform, drive initiatives with all other departments to key deliverables for the company and deliver a data analytics platform that accelerates data and non-data experts with actionable insights.

Data Engineering

The Data Engineering team works closely with business stakeholders to give them the needed data and tools to make data driven decisions. Our stack includes a plethora of tools, namely Snowflake, Fivetran and Power BI and a few others for a complete modern stack.

Job Description

Tech Leads are responsible for improving and upkeeping a solid, scalable, and reliable data platform for all analyses and reporting. OutSystems is a data-centric company where everyone is accountable for the success of their activities in a quantifiable way.

As a senior member of the team, you will provide direction to other team members by overseeing development, testing and documentation of developed solutions, while fostering strong stakeholder relationships for ongoing business.

Key Responsibilities

This role will be responsible for the ownership of the enterprise data warehouse, working closely with business experts to improve the data warehouse in order to have a single source of truth with coherent and reliable data for all company metrics.

Data Governance
Creating single sources of truth for overlapping data, consumable by business users
Implementing technical and business data validation rules
Align with data scientists, analysts, product owners and business experts to accelerate their exploratory analyses and evaluate a later integration of such analyses into the data warehouse ETL
Improve our best practices, ensuring a reliable and solid delivery process
Critical Requirements
Excellent communication skills for different audiences
Proven experience in data requirement gathering and analysis, with a tech-agnostic approach
Solid knowledge of Data Modeling (emphasis on Dimensional Modeling) and data warehousing
Experience in modern BI systems including ETL/ELT development
Experience processing significant amounts of structured and unstructured data
Programming knowledge to clean and process data sets (e.g.: Scala, Java, Python, JavaScript, etc)
Transparency and ability to establish long lasting trusting and supportive relationships with the team and other stakeholders
Knowledge in data mining, machine learning and/or NLP is a plus, but not a requirement
Skills & Qualifications
5+ years of experience in an Data Engineering or similar role
3+ years experience managing a project with a small (or bigger) team
3+ years of experience creating data sets, reports and dashboards using PowerBI, Tableau or similar analytical tools
Experience managing client expectations and promoting alignment
Strong SQL skills, namely T-SQL (knowing Snowflake is a plus)
Fluency in English, written and spoken (mandatory)
Not required, but a plus when existing:
Knowledge of Pentaho Data Integration, Kettle or Apache Hop
Experience with the AWS or Azure data stack
What do we have to offer you?
A company that continues to grow, change and innovate, and gives our teams the space to be proactive and creative.
Real career opportunities. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is an obvious possibility, but we also offer the possibility for lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering specific skills.
Work colleagues that are as smart, hardworking and driven as you – and a team that is global.
A company culture that is based on transparency, teamwork and excellence (as promised in our Small Book of the Few Big Rules and delivered every day.)
Disrupting the status quo is in our DNA. In fact, it’s why our company exists.
We “Ask Why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and sometimes even uncover a better way.
Are you ready for the next step in your career? Then we’d love to hear from you!

OutSystems nurtures an inclusive culture of diversity, where everyone feels empowered to be their authentic self and perform at their best. A company that embraces the creativity and innovation that comes through diverse perspectives. We are committed to creating a team that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive equal consideration regardless of race, place of origin, color, age, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, protected veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by law.

About the job
Who Are Tide

At Tide, we’re on a mission to save businesses time and money. We’re the leading provider of UK SME business accounts and one of the fastest-growing FinTechs in the UK. Using the latest tech, we design solutions with SMEs in mind and our member-driven financial platform is transforming the business banking market. Not only do we offer our members business accounts and related banking services, but also a comprehensive set of highly connected admin tools for businesses.

Tide is about doing what you love. We’re looking for someone to join us on our exciting scale up journey and be a part of something special. We are wanting passionate Tideans to drive innovation and help build a best-in-class platform to support our members. You will be comfortable in ambiguous situations and will be able to navigate the evolving FinTech environment. Imagine shaping how millions of Tide members discover and engage with business banking platforms and building this on a global scale.

What We’re Looking For

Sharp, detail-oriented, collaborative and flexible, self-starter to drive the quality of the FinCrime Team at Tide.

As a FinCrime Quality Assurance Analyst You’ll Be

Monitoring Financial Crime analysts’ adherence to key processes
Participating in and leading calibration sessions with the stakeholders to ensure proper feedback is provided. This includes meetings with FinCrime Team Leads, FinCrime Managers and Head of FinCrime
Implementing and constantly improving the QA scorecards in order to catch up with the new processes and procedures
Generating QA reports on a daily/weekly/monthly basis
Achieving the sampling plan target that was given
Conducting monthly performance review for each analyst - review performance, share findings and set goals
Working closely with the peers to implement quality strategies and drive the overall project’s performance.

What Makes You a Great Fit

You have 1+ year of experience in a FinCrime QA or 2 LOD role
You have excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills in English
You have good understanding of UK/EEA AML/CTF framework, including 4MLD, POCA, UK MLRs, FCA regulations, JMLSG, PSD2
You have experience in AML, Risk or Compliance related role and decent knowledge of the ongoing trends in the area
You must be self-motivator and self-starter
You are focused on quality and customer service
You have exceptional listening and analytical skills
You must be able to effectively deal with people at all levels inside and outside of the Company
You have ability to multitask and successfully operate in a fast paced, team environment
You must adapt well to change and successfully set and adjust priorities as needed.

What You’ll Get In Return

Make work, work for you! We are embracing new ways of working and support flexible working arrangements. With our Working Out of Office (WOO) policy our colleagues can work remotely from home or anywhere in their home country. Additionally, you can work from a different country for 90 days of the year. Plus, you’ll get:

25 days paid annual leave
3 paid days off for volunteering or L&D activities
Extended maternity and paternity leave covered by the company
Personal L&D budget in the amount of 1000 BGN per year
Additional health & dental insurance
Mental wellbeing platform
Fully covered Multisports card
Food vouchers
Snacks, light food, drinks in the office
WFH equipment allowance

Tidean Ways of Working

At Tide, we’re Member First and Data Driven, but above all, we’re One Team. Our Working Out of Office (WOO) policy allows you to work from anywhere in the world for up to 90 days a year. We are remote first, but when you do want to meet new people, collaborate with your team or simply hang out with your colleagues, our offices are always available and equipped to the highest standard. We offer flexible working hours and trust our employees to do their work well, at times that suit them and their team.

Tide is a place for everyone

At Tide, we believe that we can only succeed if we let our differences enrich our culture. Our Tideans come from a variety of backgrounds and experience levels. We consider everyone irrespective of their ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status. We believe it’s what makes us awesome at solving problems! We are One Team and foster a transparent and inclusive environment, where everyone’s voice is heard.
