About the job

Description de l'entreprise

Chez nexDigital, cabinet de conseil IT, nous accompagnons nos clients dans la modernisation de leur SI pour le rendre plus agile, plus ouvert et plus performant. Nous nous basons sur les meilleures technologies et sur les partenaires les plus innovants pour aider nos clients à se transformer. Nos projets sont réalisés par des architectes, des développeurs, des consultants, des experts qui maitrisent les technologies (API, plateforme d’échanges, microservices,...) mais aussi les transformations organisationnelles qu’elles nécessitent (agilité, DevOps, automation,…).



Nous cherchons à renforcer notre équipe avec des consultants souhaitant apporter leur expertise à ces projets, dans une démarche d’apprentissage continu.

Notre positionnement comme experts technologiques nous amène également à partager notre savoir-faire au travers des activités suivantes:
Formation de nos équipes et de nos clients
Animation de communautés (meetup, blog, conférence,...)
Participation actives à des événements Devoteam ou Partenaires (APIDays, Redhat Summit, Google Next, ...)


Description du poste

Comme développeur back-end, vous serez amené à :
Concevoir et développer des microservices et des API Rest
Travailler en mode agile dans des approches DevOps
Apporter une Expertise technologique
Et rapidement, gérer les projets et les équipes et/ou devenir lead technique sur un domaine


Qualifications

De formation école d’Ingénieur ou équivalent, vous avez une ou plusieurs expériences dans un des domaines suivants :
Développement nodeJS, JavaScript, Python, ...
Plateforme de type ESB/ETL (TIBCO, MuleSoft, Webmethods, Talend,...)
API Rest / Json / swagger / openAPI / RAML
Microservices / serverless
Docker / Kubernetes


Vous avez un goût prononcé pour des domaines innovants et porteurs et les nouvelles technologies.

Vous avez un bon niveau d’anglais à l’écrit et à l’oral.

D’un naturel dynamique, autonome, curieux, rigoureux et persévérant, vous êtes particulièrement motivé pour rejoindre une structure dynamique en pleine croissance.

Vous souhaitez évoluer sur de l’expertise en participant à des projets stratégiques dans le domaine de la transformation numérique.

Contactez-nous pour échanger sur nos attentes et vos ambitions !




Informations supplémentaires

" Le Groupe Devoteam oeuvre pour l'égalité des chances, pour la promotion de ses collaboratrices et de ses collaborateurs au mérite et lutte activement contre toute forme de discrimination. Nous sommes persuadés que la diversité contribue à la créativité, au dynamisme et à l'excellence de notre organisation. Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap".

About the job
Want to join us? 💻

Rand App is just a simple digital wallet that reimagines the way you spend, send, and earn money easily and better than your traditional bank. Our mission is to put the power of finance into everyone’s hands, empowering people with smart financial tools. This is accomplished by leveraging the latest technologies for maximum return using Web3 and AI technology.
We’ve been featured in several well-known media such as Yahoo Finance, La Vanguardia, El Mundo, and Markets Insider. We’ve also closed $5M+ in financial rounds with +10 influential and value-added funds.

Rand is the new way to bank for everyone and anyone that wants to take control of their financial future and live their best life!

Your Work-life Opportunity 🎯

We are currently looking for a motivated QA Automation Engineer to lead Rand’s quality assurance processes. You’ll play a key role in delivering high-quality and well-functioning software next to our Technology and Product team. Screening for errors, and defining and implementing an automated testing system will be some of your top priorities in this position.

If you have experience in mobile app testing and are passionate about quality, don’t hesitate to apply: this opportunity is for you!

A day in your life as a QA Automation Engineer ⚙️

Understand the software's technical aspects and the user requirements to define the best QA process
Design, build and develop automated and manual testing systems to improve the security, scalability, and reliability of our product
Own the quality strategy, review functional/design specifications, and prepare test plans
Perform pre-release testing of our mobile app using various automation frameworks to ensure the quality of the product
Report bugs and errors to the Tech and Product team, analyzing the importance and priority of them
Design, maintain, and execute test cases and analyze results
Create logs to document testing phases so the team can reproduce and diagnose the issues
Be involved in clarifying business requirements and user stories
Work together with the Tech team to ensure the quality and performance of our code
Collaborate with the Investment team on testing and validating all the trading strategies we develop on the Blockchain environment (DeFi)

You’ll rock at this role if you have ✨

+3 years of experience as QA Automation Engineer, ideally in a mobile app environment
Solid knowledge of test automation practices
Previous experience working with Selenium, Appium, Xamarin, or similar tools
Knowledge of performance, scale, and load testing
Experience testing JavaScript/Typescript/Node applications
Experience in both front-end/integration and API testing
Knowledge of code languages such as Python or JavaScript
Previous experience working in a start-up is a plus
Ability to quickly learn and become proficient with complex applications

Joining us you’ll also get to enjoy our perks 🚀

Flexible work schedule
Flexible time off
Remote working
Competitive compensation
Worldwide boot camps to work collaboratively and have fun together
Young and international work environment

What You’ll Find When Working At Rand Network 📢
Go big or go home: We are energetic, innovative, and ambitious. We play to win.
Trust and accountability: You have 100% autonomy that comes with 100% accountability.
Team First: Everything works when the whole team shines.
User-centric: Our users and community are the fuel for the organization.
Adaptive to changes: We are curious and open-minded and we believe in taking risks, even if we fail, to evolve and be better every day.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!😀 If you think you would be a good fit don’t hesitate to apply.

About the job
Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?

We are seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to work on a variety of company reporting requests. The ideal candidate for this role displays extreme passion for data and problem solving and is driven to ask the right questions to surface up business insights.

Your Role In Action

Interact with business users to understand reporting requirements and create new and/or update existing Tableau dashboards to satisfy the business need.
Provide excellent customer support when assessing, managing, and responding to requests and connecting our internal customers to relevant data.
Create and maintain documentation including, but not limited to, data catalog, best practices, SOPs, information governance policies, etc.
Interact with BI data engineers whenever data schemas need redesigning to accommodate new reporting requirements.

Your Skills

Intermediate knowledge of a CRM tool, preferably Salesforce

Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Basic understanding of data modeling, data schemas
Ability to read SQL and/or Snowflake queries
Ability to analyze and document complex business processes
Being an excellent communicator, both written & verbal
Being able to work efficiently under pressure and meets deadlines while balancing customer requests across multiple stakeholders
Exceling at cross-team collaboration and knowledge sharing
Experience in a customer (internal or external) facing role
Experience with a SaaS or subscription-based software company
Displaying extreme passion for data and problem solving – being driven to ask the right questions and surface up business insights

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Long-term incentive program

Training investment program

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

job_title: Freelance Market Research Analyst & Interviewer - Bulgaria
description:
About the job
Description

This position is for self-employed contract work only. All work is coordinated remotely.

Please note this opportunity is for contract/per project work in Bulgaria (we would contact you when a project is available and fits your background, send you an offer to work in that specific project for a given period of time and pay you after you complete all required deliverables).

We rely on our freelance local contributors to help us carry out research locally - working remotely with our Project Managers, once assigned to a specific project.

Our research addresses the following types of questions in order to deliver insightful business intelligence:
How much fruit juice was sold in this region this year? Why did sales increase/decline over the previous year? What companies are the leading players? What share of sales is held by the leading brands?
Is there a market for this product in X country? What channels could it be sold through? How should the product be positioned to maximize its potential?
Why is company X doing better than company Y? What strategy is being employed and how is this supported operationally?

Main Tasks Required
Desk research: Reviewing and collecting information from secondary sources
Storechecks: Visiting retail stores and points of sales to record product information
Trade interviews: Conducting face to face or phone interviews with different key players of the value chain: manufacturers, suppliers, distributors
Data building: Collecting and manipulating data points in order to build market sizes, brand participation, etc.
Analysis: Analysing quantitative and qualitative data / information - Hypothesis testing

By sending your resume you are agreeing to our privacy policy and opting in to recruitment communication for 24 months. You may opt out at any time

Requirements

Here is what we are looking for:
Must be Located in Bulgaria
Minimum availability of 30 hours per week when working in projects
University title (4+ years), preferably in areas where strong analytical skills are required (Business, Economics, Marketing, Sociology, Anthropology, etc.).
Fluency in English
Previous experience working remotely or on a project basis
Tenacity in the pursuit of information and a keen attention to detail
Strong communication skills - conducting interviews with industry players is a key part of projects
Excellent time-management, organization and self-motivation skills
High level of numeracy - Ability to work with, analyse, and interpret data
Proven proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

Benefits
Continuous training in our market research methodologies
Collaboration with an international team
The ability to contribute to research projects for top multinationals in key industries such as Beauty and Personal Care, Packaged Foods, Consumer Health, etc.
The opportunity to develop and position yourself as a local market research expert
Flexible remote work
Comprehensive compensation

About the job
Description

Position at Premier Research

At Premier Research, we help biotech and specialty pharma companies transform life-changing ideas into reality. What we do is profoundly connected to saving and improving lives, and we recognize our staff members are the most valuable asset in delivering success. Inspiring and nurturing staff to do their best work means a better, healthier future for all. We’re a community of 2,000 people in more than 20 countries delivering unmatched expertise, operational skills, and dedication to meet the most challenging needs facing clinical trials today.

We’re looking for an Associate Database Developer to join our Data Management team that is passionate about improving healthcare through innovative clinical research. As a member of the Premier Research team, you’ll help create tangible solutions for patients in need while building cross-functional partnerships that enable your growth and success.

Hours of work for this role are Monday to Friday 11am - 7pm.

Why choose Premier Research?

Premier Research is more than a company – it’s a community of people that truly care about one another, about our clients, and about our mission of furthering research to improve the lives of patients in critical need. Our cultural anchors – Caring & Empathy, Empowerment, Aspiration, One Team – mirror the flexibility and trust that our team embodies. As a Premier team member, you have the power to make an impact, regardless of job title and location. Our dedication to biotech and specialty pharma is unlike any other. We provide our staff with innovative technologies and continuous learning opportunities so that they have the tools they need to be successful.

What You'll Be Doing
Creating electronic Case Report Forms (eCRFs) according to finalized protocols for EDC studies
Creating data entry screens according to the approved annotated Case Report Form (CRF) for paper studies
Designing, building and testing clinical databases with the focus on the build
Writing basic scripts in Programming language
Working in collaboration with the Data Management project team, Statistician & Project Manager
What We Are Searching For

This is an excellent entry level role ideally suited to a Graduate level qualified candidate who is technically minded, committed to learning (full training provided) and with a high level of spoken English ability.
Prior experience in clinical database development – an advantage, but not mandatory – full training provided
Experience working in a CRO or Pharmaceutical Company – beneficial, but not essential
A passion for learning, applying skills and being responsible and accountable Fluency in verbal and written English, essential
Excellent communication skills are required
Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.
Ability to work well within a team
Because we are transforming life-changing ideas into new medical treatments for a diverse population, we require the perspectives of a diverse staff thinking creatively, challenging ideas, and solving complex problems fearlessly. Through a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and empowerment, we create a community of belonging that welcomes differences, fuels innovation, and better connects us to the patients, physicians, and customers we serve.

We hire people that add to our culture, then invest in developing skills and abilities. If you are excited about this role, but your past experiences do not perfectly align with the position as described, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be exactly the right candidate for this role or others.

#Remote

About the job
Intro
Werde mit uns Teil der Energiewende: mit nue bieten wir Softwarelösungen und Services zur Vereinfachung von Geschäftsprozessen im energiewirtschaftlichen Umfeld. Unser erstes Produkt “certflow” geht ein sehr akutes Problem an – den komplexen und bürokratischen Anlagenzertifizierungsprozess für Photovoltaik-Großanlagen! Mit unserem Produkt certflow stehen wir am Anfang und wollen nun den Markt erobern, dafür suchen wir dich als (Junior) Business Developer:in!

💚 Wir sind…
Jelena und Gratian und suchen Teammitglieder auf Augenhöhe, die Lust auf eine offene, kreative und transparente Kultur haben. Bei uns gewinnt nicht die Hierarchie oder die lauteste Stimme, sondern die beste Idee, weshalb wir Wert auf eine starke Meinung und eine positive Diskussionskultur, aber auch auf verantwortungsvolles, strukturiertes Arbeiten legen.

🗣 Wir bieten…
Wettbewerbsfähige Vergütungspakete (kein Start-Up Gehalt)
Vollzeit, Teilzeit: alles ist möglich
Einen 100% remote Arbeitsplatz – mit gelegentlichen Zusammentreffen in Berlin, sofern möglich
die Chance, einen konkreten Mehrwert für die Energiewende zu leisten
den Freiraum, als Teammitglied “der ersten Stunde” das Unternehmen mit aufzubauen und mit dem Unternehmen zu wachsen
deine Arbeit hat einen direkten Einfluss auf nue und du siehst sofort Ergebnisse
kleines und sehr dynamisches Team, das Lust auf Großes hat
einen starken Energy Venture Builder im Hintergrund und Zugang zu dessen Startup-, Konzern- und Investorennetzwerk

💻 Deine Aufgaben…
Du entwickelst neue kreative Vertriebsstrategien und Strukturen (z.B. neue Prozesse, Vertriebsunterlagen oder Implementierung neuer Tools)
Du nutzt CRM- und Schwestersysteme so, dass sie maximalen Nutzen stiften
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für den gesamten Vertriebszyklus – vom Erstkontakt über die optimale Beratung bis hin zur Angebotserstellung und den Vertragsabschluss
Du bist verantwortlich für den Auf- und Ausbau langfristiger Geschäftsbeziehungen, indem du kontinuierlich im persönlichen, schriftlichen und telefonischen Austausch mit unseren Kund:innen stehst

🚀 Das zeichnet Dich aus…
Du teilst unsere Motivation, die Energiewende voranzutreiben und einen wesentlichen Beitrag zur Integration von erneuerbaren Energien zu leisten
Du hast erste Erfahrungen im Vertrieb gesammelt, vorzugsweise in der Energiebranche oder mit Handwerksbetrieben (Photovoltaik, Wärmepumpen, Batteriespeicher) und hast Spaß daran 🙂
